    Getting started

    segtools.Rmd
    library(segtools)
library(dplyr)
library(vroom)
library(janitor)

    Assume I have a .csv file with BGM and REF columns (like the one in the segtools inst/extdata/ folder:

    test_data <- vroom::vroom(
  file = "https://bit.ly/3JwGoiP", delim = ",")
dplyr::glimpse(test_data)
#> Rows: 9,891
#> Columns: 2
#> $ BGM <dbl> 121, 212, 161, 191, 189, 104, 293, 130, 261, 147, 83, 132, 146, 24…
#> $ REF <dbl> 127, 223, 166, 205, 210, 100, 296, 142, 231, 148, 81, 131, 155, 25…

    The segtools package can create the following outputs

    Summary Tables

    The summary tables rely on separate functions for each table.

    Pairs table

    1. seg_pairs_table() returns the pairs comparing BGM to REF 
    seg_pair_type_tbl(df = test_data)
    Pair Type Count
    Total 9891
    BGM < REF 4710
    BGM = REF 479
    BGM > REF 4702
    REF > 600: Excluded from SEG Analysis 23
    Total included in SEG Analysis 9868

    MARD table

    1. The MARD table requires two functions:
    • seg_risk_vars() to calculate the intermediate risk variables
    risk_vars_tbl <- seg_risk_vars(df = test_data)
    • seg_mard_tbl() to calculate the Bias, MARD, CV, and lower/upper 95% CI
    seg_mard_tbl(risk_vars_tbl)
    Total Bias MARD CV Lower 95% Limit of Agreement Upper 95% Limit of Agreement
    9868 0.6% 7% 14.8% -28.3% 29.6%

    Risk grade table

    1. seg_risk_grade_tbl() returns a table of risk grades
    seg_risk_grade_tbl(risk_vars_tbl)
    ID Risk Grade Number of Pairs Percent Risk Factor Range
    1 A 9474 96% 0 - 0.5
    2 B 349 3.5% > 0.5 - 1.0
    3 C 35 0.4% > 1.0 - 2.0
    4 D 10 0.1% > 2.0 - 3.0
    5 E NA NA > 3.0

    Risk category table

    1. seg_risk_level_table() return a table of risk levels and categories
    seg_risk_cat_tbl(risk_vars_tbl)
    SEG Risk Level SEG Risk Category Number of Pairs Percent
    0 None 9474 96%
    1 Slight, Lower 294 3%
    2 Slight, Higher 55 0.6%
    3 Moderate, Lower 24 0.2%
    4 Moderate, Higher 11 0.1%
    5 Severe, Lower 10 0.1%
    6 Severe, Upper NA NA
    7 Extreme NA NA

    ISO range table

    1. seg_iso_range_tbl() returns a table of compliance ranges
    seg_iso_range_tbl(risk_vars_tbl)
    ID ISO range N Percent
    1 <= 5% or 5 mg/dL 5328 54%
    2 > 5 - 10% or mg/dL 2842 28.8%
    3 > 10 - 15% or mg/dL 1050 10.6%
    4 > 15 - 20% mg/dL 340 3.4%
    5 > 20% or 20 mg/dL 308 3.1%

    Compliant pairs table

    1. seg_binom_tbl() returns a table binomial test for compliant pairs
    seg_binom_tbl(risk_vars_tbl)
    Compliant Pairs Compliant Pairs % Lower Bound for Acceptance Lower Bound for Acceptance % Result
    9220 93.4% 9339 94.6% 93.4% < 94.6% - Does not meet BGM Surveillance Study Accuracy Standard

    Graphs

    segtools can also create the following graphs:

    The SEG Graph 

    seg_graph(
  data = test_data,
  is_path = FALSE,
  alpha_var = 3 / 4,
  size_var = 2.5,
  color_var = "gray85"
)

    The Modified Bland-Altman Plot 

    seg_modba_graph(data = test_data)
